captions.text:
Narrator:
PREVIOUSLY ON "ALL ACCESS"...

Woman: LARA DID A LOT OF TRASH
TALKING TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN.

HE REALLY WANTED TO
FIGHT YOU.
[ CROWD CHANTING INDISTINCTLY ]

Announcer:
LARA CONTINUES TO TEE OFF.
WOW!

THE FEROCIOUS POWER
OF "CANELO" ALVAREZ!

Shields: WHEN CANELO LOSES THIS
FIGHT, HE'S GONNA LOOK AT THEM,

"WHY DIDN'T YOU
TALK ME OUT OF IT?"
[ INDISTINCT CONVERSATIONS ]
[ ELECTRONIC MUSIC PLAYS ]

Narrator: HE MAY BE THE WORLD'S
YOUNGEST PAY-PER-VIEW STAR,
BUT THERE ARE TIMES

WHEN CANELO ALVAREZ STILL
NEEDS TO BE A KID.

IT'S SOMETHING
CHEPO AND EDDY REYNOSO,

THE ONLY TRAINERS HE'S EVER HAD,
KNOW FULL WELL.
[ MAN SINGING IN SPANISH ]

AAH!
[ SPEAKS SPANISH ]
I NEED A BIKE.
WHOA!
YEAH!
Man: [ LAUGHS ]
[ ALL SPEAKING SPANISH ]
[ MEN CONVERSING IN SPANISH ]

Narrator:
IT MAY LOOK LIKE FUN,

BUT IT'S ACTUALLY
A NEW PART OF CANELO'S ROUTINE.

THERE'S ROAD WORK,
AND THERE'S POOL WORK.
[ STOPWATCH BEEPS ]
[ MID-TEMPO ROCK MUSIC PLAYS ]

Narrator: THOUSANDS OF VISITORS
WHO FLOCK TO LAS VEGAS EACH DAY

SEE A BUSTLING CITY
RIFE WITH TEMPTATIONS,
BUT NOT ERISLANDY LARA,

WHO WILL TRAIN
IN RELATIVE SECLUSION.

Shields:
THIS IS A PRIVATE PLACE,
SO IT'S REALLY, REALLY NICE.

HE'S CONTENT WITH BEING HERE,
AND HE'S SO READY.

I WISH IT WAS LAST WEEK.
I MEAN, THAT'S HOW READY HE IS.
ALL HE WANT TO DO IS WIN.

HEY, HEY,
HEY, HEY, AH!
WHOA! HEY! HEY!
HEY, HEY, HEY, AH!

HOLD IT UP!
[ GRUNTS ]

HOLD IT UP!
[ GRUNTS ]

AGAIN.
[ GRUNTS ]

AGAIN.
[ GRUNTS ]
AGAIN.
[ ALARM BEEPS ]

Shields: CUBANS ARE VERY,
VERY GOOD FIGHTERS.
THEY KNOW BOXING.

THEY WAS TAUGHT
FROM A VERY YOUNG AGE.

THEY UNDERSTAND THAT BOXING IS
A SWEET SCIENCE,

AND THE SWEET SCIENCE SAYS,
"HIT, BUT DON'T GET HIT."

THE KID AIN'T GONNA GET
ANY BETTER, I THINK,
THAN ANYBODY ELSE.

YEAH, YEAH, HOT.
[ CHUCKLES ]
WHOO.

Narrator: THE SWELTERING RIGORS
OF TRAINING NEVER SEEM
TO BOTHER LARA.

Man:
[ SPEAKING SPANISH ]
[ LAUGHS ]
HIS CAMP IS ATTENDED

BY A CLOSE-KNIT GROUP
OF CUBAN EXPATRIATES...

INCLUDING A CHILDHOOD FRIEND
FROM THE NATIONAL TEAM,

MARCOS FORESTAL,
WHO DEFECTED LAST APRIL.
[ WOMAN SPEAKING SPANISH ]
[ CELLPHONE BEEPING ]

Narrator: FOR LARA, IDLE MOMENTS
CAN BE MELANCHOLY ONES.

IT'S DISTANCE
THAT DEFINES HIS PREDICAMENT.

THERE'S HIS WIFE, YUDI,
AND THEIR KIDS BACK IN HOUSTON

AND THE FAMILY
HE LEFT BEHIND IN CUBA.

BY NOW,
ALMOST TWO MONTHS INTO TRAINING,

CANELO'S BOYISH CHARM HAS GIVEN
WAY TO A PALPABLE INTENSITY.

YOU CAN FEEL THE CONFIDENCE
IN HIS CAMP.

IT'S MORE
THAN A BELIEF IN ALVAREZ.

IT'S A BELIEF THAT MEXICAN
FIGHTERS ARE SIMPLY SUPERIOR.
[ ROCK MUSIC PLAYS ]

Narrator: WITH 45 PRO BOUTS
ALREADY ON HIS RéSUMé,

CANELO HAS ACQUIRED HIS WISDOM
THE HARD WAY.

WITH EACH OPPONENT
COMES NEW LESSONS.
IN TRAINING, STRATEGY.
[ BREATHING HEAVILY ]

WHILE CHEPO AND EDDY HAVE SPENT
MORE THAN A DECADE
BUILDING UP CANELO...
[ BELL DINGS ]

LARA'S TRAINERS ARE BUSY
TRYING TO TAKE HIM DOWN.

Announcer: THE SEA OF HUMANITY
HERE AT THE ALAMODOME
ERUPTING LIKE A VOLCANO.

Shields:
ALL RIGHT, ROUND 1.
HERE WE GO.

Narrator:
RONNIE SHIELDS AND STRENGTH AND
CONDITIONING COACH ED JACKSON

STUDY CANELO'S VICTORY
OVER AUSTIN TROUT LAST YEAR.
TROUT, LIKE LARA, IS A SOUTHPAW,

ONE OF THE FEW
CANELO HAS EVER FACED.

CANELO COMES OUT
THE SAME WAY ALL THE TIME,

AND THAT'S ONE THING
LARA CAN TAKE ADVANTAGE OF.

I THINK CANELO ALVAREZ IS
A ONE-DIMENSIONAL FIGHTER.
TRUST ME --

A ONE-DIMENSIONAL GUY IS
NOT GONNA TOUCH ERISLANDY LARA.

Announcer:
TROUT'S CONTROLLING THIS ROUND,

AND CANELO KEEPING HIS HANDS
VERY LOW.

Shields:
IF THAT WAS LARA RIGHT NOW

THAT GOT CANELO
ON THE ROPES --

TRUST ME --
LARA WOULD HIT HIM

WITH EVERY SHOT
HE'S GONNA THROW
BECAUSE RIGHT THERE,

LARA'S
THE MOST ACCURATE PUNCHER

WHEN HE GOT YOU
ON THE ROPES.
CANELO, TO ME,

LOOKS LIKE HE'S JUST
SLOWED A TAD IN THIS ROUND.

HE CAN'T
KEEP PUNCHING HIM

BECAUSE NOW HIS STAMINA
AIN'T THERE.

SO HE'S JUST
LOOKING FOR ONE SHOT.

THAT'S GONNA
WORK PERFECT FOR US.

Jackson: IN THE FIFTH,
THE SIXTH, SEVENTH ROUND,

I SEE
THAT CANELO GETS WINDED.

AT THIS LEVEL,
EVERYBODY IS BASICALLY EVEN
THE FIRST FIVE OR SIX ROUNDS.

THAT'S WHEN YOU START SEPARATING
THE MEN FROM THE BOYS.

ONE SHOT.
ONE SHOT.

WHILE HE'S TRYING TO
THROW ONE-SHOTS,

WE'LL BE THROWING
10 SHOTS.
ONLY A RIGHT HAND.

MAN, WE GONNA COUNTER THE HELL
OUT OF HIS...

WE'RE GONNA SEE LARA
PUT THE CUBAN STYLE DOWN.
HIT, AND DON'T GET HIT.
SWIM WITHOUT GETTING WET.
THAT'S THE CUBAN STYLE.

Narrator: AFTER
A GRUELING SESSION AT THE GYM,

MEMBERS OF TEAM LARA GATHER
AT THEIR FAVORITE SPOT.
THE CAMARADERIE IS APPARENT.
OH, MY GOSH.
[ LAUGHTER ]

"LOOK, CHECK MY --"
"NO, NO, NO."
[ LAUGHTER ]
[ CONVERSING IN SPANISH ]
[ LAUGHS ]

Narrator: BACK IN SAN DIEGO,
CANELO IS USED TO THE ATTENTION.

BASEBALL IS KNOWN AS
AMERICA'S PASTIME

WITH AN ABUNDANCE
OF LATINO TALENT,

LIKE FIRST BASEMAN
ADRIAN GONZALEZ.

AND TODAY, HE'S INTRODUCING THE
STARS OF THE DODGERS CLUBHOUSE
TO THE MEXICAN CHAMPION.

[ 7Horse's
"METH LAB ZOSO STICKER" PLAYS ]

♪ I GOT A METH LAB ZOSO STICKER
ROLLED UP IN MY POCKET ♪

♪ GOT A SEVEN-INCH TRIGGER
FINGER ♪
♪ DON'T KNOW HOW TO STOP IT ♪
♪ GOT A ONE-WAY PILEDRIVER ♪
♪ NOWHERE LEFT TO USE IT ♪

♪ I'M SUPERCHARGED
FREEDOM FIGHTER ♪
♪ AND I'M GIVING IT ALL ♪
BRIAN. YOU, TOO.
[ CONVERSING IN SPANISH ]

Narrator:
IT'S A SKILL IN ITSELF --

DEALING WITH THE CONSTANT
REQUESTS AND MEDIA OBLIGATIONS.

LARA'S NEVER BEEN ON
A STAGE LIKE THIS,
THOUGH YOU'D NEVER KNOW IT

FROM THE WAY HE HANDLES
THE BARRAGE OF QUESTIONS.

Man: WHAT DOES HE FEEL LIKE
HE NEEDS TO DO

TO BEAT CANELO
ON THAT SATURDAY?

Man #2:
WHAT WOULD IT MEAN TO YOU

TO TAKE CARE OF BUSINESS
THE NIGHT OF THE FIGHT?

Man #3: GO GET HIM.
GO GET HIM.

Man #4: DON'T BE SCARED.
HE'S KIND OF SLOW.

Shields: EVERYTHING
THAT HE'S BEEN THROUGH --

WINNING THIS FIGHT
MAKES IT WORTHWHILE

THAT HE'S DONE EVERYTHING
THAT HE'S DONE TO GET HERE
TO THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
[ CAMERA SHUTTERS CLICKING ]

THANK YOU.
GIVE ME FIVE.
[ CHUCKLES ]

THE MOST IMPORTANT THING
IS WALKING INTO THE MGM

BECAUSE AT LEAST
YOU KNOW YOU MADE IT.

AT THAT MOMENT, IN HIS MIND,
I'M THINKING HE'S SAYING,
"I FINALLY MADE IT.

THIS IS
WHERE I'M SUPPOSED TO BE."

Narrator:
IF LARA'S FUELED BY HIS PAST,
THEN WHAT OF CANELO?

HIS DRIVE WAS FORGED DURING
AN OLD-SCHOOL APPRENTICESHIP.

IT MAKES HIM WHAT HE IS
AND WHAT HE HOPES TO BECOME.

[ BLACK REBEL MOTORCYCLE CLUB'S
"HATE THE TASTE" PLAYS ]
♪ I GOT A FATAL HEART ♪
♪ I'M TIED TO THE LIVING ♪
♪ GOT A TORTURED SOUL ♪
♪ I CAN'T GIVE IT AWAY ♪
♪ GONNA FIND A LINE ♪

Narrator: THERE'S NEVER BEEN
A FIGHTER LIKE HIM.
A PRO AT 15.
A CHAMPION BY 20.
A PAY-PER-VIEW FIXTURE AT 22.
AND NOW, A WEEK SHY OF 24,

A YOUNG MAN
WITH ANCIENT AMBITIONS --
TO RANK AMONG THE GREATS.

FOR LARA, LAS VEGAS REPRESENTS
NOT JUST HIS AMERICAN DREAM
BUT A KIND OF PROMISED LAND,

A VENUE TO FINALLY REALIZE
HIS STAR-SPANGLED DESIRE.
♪ I WANT TO RIDE WITH YOU ♪
♪ I WANT TO RIDE WITH YOU ♪
♪ I WANT TO RIDE WITH YOU ♪
♪ WHY WON'T YOU TAKE ME THERE? ♪

Narrator:
IT IS NOT A JOURNEY.

FOR THESE FIGHTERS,
IT'S A MISSION.

THEY ALWAYS KNEW THAT
THEY WERE SUPPOSED TO BE HERE.

Announcer: KNOCKDOWN
IN THE OPENING ROUND.
ERISLANDY LARA!
[ CROWD CHEERING ]

AND THERE IS CANELO DROPPING
TROUT WITH A STRAIGHT RIGHT!
♪ WHOO! ♪
♪ I WANT TO RIDE WITH YOU ♪

Narrator:
NOW THE PROUD PROVOCATEUR MEETS
THE PRECOCIOUS CHAMPION.
ONE SEEKS TO REALIZE HIS DREAM.

ANOTHER DREAMS
TO BE BOXING CHAMPION.

Announcer:
CANELO ALVAREZ!

Narrator: ON JULY 12th,
ONE DESTINY WILL BE FULFILLED.
ANOTHER DREAM FLIES HOME.
Man: BEAUTIFUL.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

-- Captions by VITAC --
 www.vitac.com

Narrator:
DON'T MISS CANELO ALVAREZ
vs. ERISLANDY LARA,

SATURDAY, JULY 12th,
LIVE ON SHOWTIME PAY-PER-VIEW.
AND RELIVE THE BATTLE

WITH "ALL ACCESS,"
THE EPILOGUE,
SATURDAY, JULY 19th.

title: All Access: Canelo vs. Lara - Episode 2

comments.author: hancel rodriguez

comments.text:
Lara proved that his mouth was bigger than his balls. He ran too much and 
showed very little heart in this fight. The sweet science is not "land a 
combo and then around until the bell rings." This is pro boxing, the fight 
game, the hurt game. The sweet science is to kick your opponents ass. ﻿
comments.author: hawkermustang

comments.text:
Lara landed 55 jabs and 55 power punches to Canelo's 7 jabs and 88 power 
punches for an overall accuracy rate of 28% as opposed to Canelo's 23%, 
 115 - 113 Lara    115 - 113 Canelo   117 - 111 Canelo?? by a MEXICAN 
Nationalist Judge, who the fuck would hire him? Lara won and it was stacked 
against him, and all of these idiots saying "HE RAN, LARA RUNS A MARATHON" 
Don't know sheiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit about boxing. Canelo is a one dimensional 
flat footed fighter, and lara is a Technical Counter Puncher, but Lara won 
most rounds and they still gave it to Canelo, that biased judge needs to be 
fired. ﻿
comments.author: DJ Serpent

comments.text:
+Yohanan Jorge LOL well you just sound so stupid. Canelo was the one that 
landed the more effective and harder punches judges prefer that than clean 
jabs. Almost every round was close but they take into consideration who is 
doing the most damage and that was Canelo with the hard body shots and the 
cut he gave Lara. This isn't the amateurs, and that's how Lara fought. So 
really you don't know shit. The bottom line is that Lara didn't do enough 
to win.
comments.author: Shock Wavez

comments.text:
+Shock Wavez But you're wrong because Lara landed cleaner punches, than 
Canelo's wide swings hitting ropes and being aggressive doesn't get you 
points. This is boxing not a street brawl, n00b don't know your sheiit, and 
that's not true since Floyd is a counter puncher and wins like every fight 
even if he had trouble with aggressive fighters like Maidana. It's all 
about who iss the money cash cow.
comments.author: DJ Serpent

comments.text:
Actually you don't know shit about boxing. When they pretty much land the 
same number of shots the judges favor the fighter that is more aggressive 
and lands the cleaner more effective shots, also more judges prefer cleaner 
power punches than jabs. Lara fought like an amateur fighter, he let the 
judges decide the outcome in a close fight and it bit him in the ass. I had 
Canelo winning 115-113. Stats show that in Vegas judges almost always favor 
the aggressor than the counter puncher.
comments.author: Shock Wavez

comments.text:
ULTIMA HORA: Acaban de arrestar a Robert Byrd el arbitro de la pelea Canelo 
vs Lara, Despues de Canelo decir que Lara corrio toda la noche sin tirar

la cara de Canelo.﻿

comments.text: lara ran like a bitch!﻿
comments.author: Gunit713 AJ (gingerfox130)

comments.text: Lara vs Mayweather!﻿
comments.author: Victor Valladares

comments.text:
Lara got what he deserved. A loss. He did not give Canelo the fight he 
promised he would give him. You don't win by running the entire fight and 
taking pot shots here and there, or quick 1-2's "here and there". He did 
NOT make Canelo look bad as he stated after the fight. Mayweather runs, but 
at least he throws a ton of punches/combos. Canelo should learn the art of 
cutting off the ring. Lara was so predictable, all Canelo had to do was cut 
off the ring. Instead he reached... and would miss, not being able to 
stretch far enough to connect. An extremely boring fight courtesy of Lara. 
Not deserving of a win over the 'A' side at all. Fair enough was the 
decision. Alot of people would've been upset over a decision for Lara after 
that lackluster performance. I heard no boos for this decision, but we 
would've heard alot, had it gone the other way.﻿
comments.author: Thomas Lytle

comments.text:
